name: unitarianism
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the beliefs and activities of a part of the Christian Church that does not believe in the Trinity (= the existence of one God in three forms, the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit): North American Unitarianism emerged largely from within the religious establishment of New England Puritanism. Unitarianism as a theology is the belief in the single personality of God in contrast to the doctrine of the Trinity - three persons in one God.
